meanings.sent1: She externalises her thoughts by writing them down.
meanings.sent2: The plant externalises its roots to absorb nutrients from the soil.
meanings.sent3: The artist externalises her emotions through vibrant colors on the canvas.
meanings.sent4: His smile externalises the joy he feels inside.
meanings.sent5: The explosion externalises the force of nature in a powerful display.

meanings.definition: To attribute to an external source
meanings.sent1: He externalises his success to the support of his family.
meanings.sent2: The superstition externalises bad luck to black cats.
meanings.sent3: The student externalises his lack of preparation by blaming the teacher.
meanings.sent4: The author externalises the inspiration for her novel to her travels.
meanings.sent5: The detective externalises the crime to a mysterious figure lurking in the shadows.
